dcterms:creator: T.D. Anderson
dcterms:description: The FATE study investigates the relationship between microvascular function and cardiovascular events in a cohort of firefighters, providing long-term results that highlight the predictive value of microvascular health.
dcterms:title: Firefighters and Their Endothelium (FATE) study

dcterms:creator: R. Rosenberry
M. D. Nelson
dcterms:description: This dataset reviews various methods for assessing reactive hyperemia, discussing its mechanisms and considerations for accurate measurement.
dcterms:title: Reactive Hyperemia

dcterms:creator: R. Rosenberry
dcterms:description: This dataset provides insights into age-related microvascular dysfunction using near-infrared spectroscopy, highlighting its potential as a diagnostic tool.
dcterms:title: Near-Infrared Spectroscopy (NIRS)

dcterms:creator: F.F.M. de Mul
dcterms:description: This dataset presents a physiological model for interpreting arterial spin labeling reactive hyperemia in calf muscles, providing insights into blood flow dynamics.
dcterms:title: Laser-Doppler Perfusion Monitoring

dcterms:creator: H.-J. Chen
G.A. Wright
dcterms:description: This dataset focuses on a physiological model for interpreting MRI-derived microvascular reactive hyperemia, emphasizing its application in calf muscles.
dcterms:title: MRI-derived microvascular reactive hyperemia
